techmeme.title: PitchBook: seven banks' ~$13B loans to Elon Musk to buy X have been "hung" for two years, weighing on balance sheets, the worst buyout for banks since 2008-09 (Wall Street Journal)
Black Myth: Wukong, a Chinese-made, Tencent-backed game, became Steam's fourth most popular title ever within hours of its launch with 1.4M+ concurrent players (Bloomberg)
Updated antitrust complaint: the DOJ says Ticketmaster's push for nontransferable SafeTix tickets, rolled out in 2019, aimed to make using rival services harder (Gaby Del Valle/The Verge)
TSMC breaks ground on its €10B chip fab in Dresden, Germany, its first European plant; the EU approves Germany's ~€5B subsidy for the project (Kamil Kowalcze/Bloomberg)
US labor and environmental groups submit comments to the Commerce Department saying draft health and environmental assessments for new chip factories fall short (Justine Calma/The Verge)
